name: places/ChIJe87DjbRZwokRUgQlicOVv7Q
adrFormatAddress: 405-403 11th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text: Took this bus to Canada once, from New York. What a surreal experience. Hope they bring back the route! Meanwhile, their trade in policy for tickets is unmatched. The key is trading it in before the trip. Excellent service, drivers with great sense of humor + compassionate customer service = 100/100! Please keep up the excellent work!

text.text: Took this bus to Canada once, from New York. What a surreal experience. Hope they bring back the route! Meanwhile, their trade in policy for tickets is unmatched. The key is trading it in before the trip. Excellent service, drivers with great sense of humor + compassionate customer service = 100/100! Please keep up the excellent work!

originalText.text: Stood out on the rain for 45 minutes in the driving rain while the bus sat there empty, no one allowed to board during the down pour. Took off and an hour into the trip the bus stopped along the highway for 40 minutes so the motor could cool down. The bus smells heavily of bathroom cleaning chemicals to the point where I dug a mask out of my just so I wouldn’t vomit from the smell. This is the last time I take this bus. I’m sticking with Vamoose, a much better bus company.

originalText.text: First time using the Mega Bus into NYC. Did a round trip from Baltimore and it was quite a pleasant experience. Seats were comfortable although they don't recline. Clean bathroom as well. Got lucky with the traffic both in and out the city. Good drop off location in 34th street, within walking distance of Hudson Yards subway station.

text.text: First time using the Mega Bus into NYC. Did a round trip from Baltimore and it was quite a pleasant experience. Seats were comfortable although they don't recline. Clean bathroom as well. Got lucky with the traffic both in and out the city. Good drop off location in 34th street, within walking distance of Hudson Yards subway station.

originalText.text:
THE WORST!!!
I took the wrong bus and get to Baltimore. I did show my ticket to whoever responded and the ticket is to NY. I don’t know what is the problem with the driver, he is racism or something because I can’t think of any other excuse that he would gave a wrong boarding location to me in purpose. If I didn’t search up, I would’ve wait at the other side of the parking lot and miss the bus.
I got a big suitcase and have to ask another passenger to help putting it in because whoever works there doesn’t do anything. When he saw me walking towards him with the suitcase, he walked away.

originalText.text:
It's cheap for last-minute bookings and is generally on time or even early., so I'd be willing to take it if needed, but there are a bunch of negatives that keep this from the top tier of non-Greyhound bus companies.

They always fill the buses to the brim, prices are more expensive than competitors when booking with a lot of lead time, and they no longer offer Wi-Fi.  The last one is what's killer for me:  sure it's probably hard to offer Wi-Fi on a double-decker bus, but it's very inconvenient burning through my cellular data quota to get work done on my laptop when other companies have working Wi-Fi without much issue.

Overall I wouldn't avoid it but I wouldn't go out of my way to use it again either.
